name: Xhovani Mali
label: Graduate Student at NYU Tandon | Software & Hardware Engineer
summary: I’ve built a diverse engineering background by working across industries — from microcontrollers and FPGA design to aerospace, neuromorphic computing, and fintech. This breadth of experience reflects both curiosity and adaptability: I thrive at the intersection of software and hardware, where performance, reliability, and real-world impact meet.

work_experience.summary: Designing and verifying digital pipelines for neuromorphic, event-based vision systems.
highlights: Designed and verified SystemVerilog modules for event-based vision processing and real-time spatio-temporal filtering.
Built a Verilator-based simulation pipeline to replay sensor data, generate frame dumps, and visualize decoder output.
Diagnosed timing, coordinate-mapping, and data-format issues using structured testbenches and waveform analysis.
Collaborated with algorithm and software engineers to align RTL behavior with reference models and system requirements.

work_experience.summary: Developed software and automation for mission-critical audio and communications systems.
highlights: Developed a Python-based test automation framework for speech intelligibility validation, reducing runtime by ~40%.
Built a Flask web application and CLI for real-time audio system control, monitoring, and register configuration.
Integrated automated testing into embedded firmware simulation flows, significantly reducing manual validation time per cycle.

work_experience.summary: Contributed to R&D for high-performance networking and electronic systems.
highlights: Deployed containerized 5G core network simulators using Docker and Linux to evaluate open-source platforms.
Ported network protocol bridge RTL across Xilinx FPGA architectures, resolving hardware compatibility and register mapping issues.
Characterized PCIe network interface performance with loopback testing and packet profiling to identify throughput bottlenecks.

work_experience.summary: Specialized in AV system integration, embedded control, and enterprise deployments.

Collaborated with project managers and clients to translate technical requirements into robust AV solutions.

work_experience.summary: Worked on hardware validation, digital design, and FPGA-based communication interfaces.

Performed FPGA-based hardware validation to confirm product functionality, timing behavior, and system integration.
Improved SPI robustness and reliability for better interoperability with embedded systems.

work_experience.summary: Supported electrical engineering projects at a large industrial site.
highlights: Updated MCC documentation and sensor configurations to reflect field conditions and design changes.

research_experience.organization: NYU Processor Design Team – VIP Program

projects.title: FPGA-Accelerated Market Behavior Classifier
projects.summary: Financial engineering capstone implementing a quantized LSTM model for real-time limit order book analysis on FPGA hardware.
highlights: Designed a compact LSTM architecture for market microstructure classification using PyTorch and Brevitas.
Used FINN and QONNX to map the model to FPGA, with estimated latency in the low microsecond range and 1M+ inferences/sec. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}
Built a C++ limit order book simulator to generate labeled sequences that capture spoofing, liquidity sweeps, and momentum events. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

projects.title: Digital Signal Processing Filter for Time-Series Forecasting
projects.summary: Autoregressive forecasting system using Linear Predictive Coding (LPC) and Burg’s algorithm on financial data.
highlights: Implemented LPC-based forecasting with Burg’s method to model short-term financial time series.
Evaluated prediction accuracy on historical datasets and tuned filter order for stability vs. responsiveness.
Packaged experiments into reproducible notebooks and scripts for further research.
